meanings.definition: To serve as an official in a ceremony or event.
meanings.sent1: She will be officiating the wedding ceremony next week.
meanings.sent2: The judge will be officiating the swearing-in ceremony.
meanings.sent3: Officiating the school play made her feel important.
meanings.sent4: Officiating the meeting, she directed everyone with authority.
meanings.sent5: Officiating the event, she ensured everything ran smoothly.

meanings.definition: To perform the duties of an official in a game or competition.
meanings.sent1: He enjoys officiating basketball games on weekends.
meanings.sent2: The referee will be officiating the soccer match tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: Officiating the chess tournament, he had to make tough calls.
meanings.sent4: She was like a conductor officiating a symphony of players on the field.
meanings.sent5: Officiating the race, he made sure all rules were followed.
